<br>
Aggravated assaults over the last 12 months are <h8>`r ifelse(assaults_city$inc_prior3yearavgtolast12>=0," up"," down")` `r ifelse(assaults_city$inc_prior3yearavgtolast12>=0,assaults_city$inc_prior3yearavgtolast12,substring(assaults_city$inc_prior3yearavgtolast12,2))`%</h8> compared to the annual average over the last three years.

The city averaged <h8>`r prettyNum(round(assaults_city$last12mos/52,0), big.mark=",")`</h8> aggravated assaults a week over the last 12 months. In 2019, that number was <h8>`r prettyNum(round(assaults_city$total19/52,0), big.mark=",")`</h8> a week.

The totals include only aggravated assaults, which police generally define as someone being attacked or seriously injured by another person, whether or not they used a firearm or other weapon.

<subhead>A closer look at Raleigh aggravated assaults neighborhood by neighborhood</subhead>

The danger is not the same neighborhood to neighborhood. ABC11's data team looked at the Raleigh Police Department's data by neighborhood from 2019 through `r format(asofdate, "%B %d, %Y")`.

The map color-codes each neighborhood by the aggravated assault rate over the last 12 months. The three darker blues represent neighborhoods with aggravated assault rates that are higher than the citywide rate. You can also click the box in the bottom right corner to see neighborhoods by the number of aggravated assaults.

Click on any neighborhood on the map to see detailed numbers, rates and trends. You can also search for a street name, place, landmark or zip code.

<br>

```{r cars, echo=FALSE,out.width='100%',out.height='600'}
# assault MAP
# Set bins for numbers of crimes for assaults map
assaultbins1 <- c(0,
                150,
                250,
                400,
                500,
                1000)
assaultbins2 <- c(0,
                100,
                200,
                300,
                400,
                500)
assaultpal1 <- colorBin(c("#aecfe6",
                             "#2787d6",
                             "#0058f6",
                             "#003ca6",
                             "#00215c"), assaults_district$rate_last12, bins = assaultbins1,na.color = "#51585f")

assaultpal2 <- colorBin(c("#aecfe6",
                             "#2787d6",
                             "#0058f6",
                             "#003ca6",
                             "#00215c"), assaults_district$last12mos, bins = assaultbins2,na.color = "#51585f")


# Create quick labels for assaults map
assaultlabel <- paste(sep="",
                     "<popuptitle>",
                     prettyNum(assaults_district$last12mos, big.mark=","),
                     " aggravated assaults </popuptitle><br>",
                     " in the last 12 months in the <b>",
                     assaults_district$district_name,
                     "</b> police district, which includes the <b>",
                     assaults_district$placename,
                     "</b> areas, home to an estimated ",
                     prettyNum(assaults_district$population, big.mark=","),
                     " people.

# Creating police districts map for types of crimes
raleigh_assault_map <- leaflet(assaults_district, options = leafletOptions(zoomControl = FALSE, zoomSnap = 0.5, zoomDelta=0.5)) %>%
  htmlwidgets::onRender("function(el, x) {
L.control.zoom({ position: 'topright' }).addTo(this)
}") %>%
  setView(-78.65, 35.79, zoom = 11.5) %>% 
  addProviderTiles(provider = "CartoDB.Positron") %>%
  addPolygons(color = "white", 
              popup = assaultlabel,
              popupOptions = popupOptions(maxWidth ="200", 
                                          minWidth ="200"),
              weight = 2, 
              smoothFactor = 0.5,
              opacity = 0.6, 
              fillOpacity = 0.6,
              fillColor = ~assaultpal1(rate_last12),
              group="Rate") %>% 
    addPolygons(color = "white", 
              popup = assaultlabel,
              popupOptions = popupOptions(maxWidth ="200", 
                                          minWidth ="200"),
              weight = 2, 
              smoothFactor = 0.5,
              opacity = 0.6, 
              fillOpacity = 0.6,
              fillColor = ~assaultpal2(last12mos),
              group="Number") %>% 
  addSearchOSM(options = searchOptions(autoCollapse=FALSE, minLength = 3,zoom=13, position="topleft")) %>%
    onRender("function(el, x) {
        $('input.search-input')[0].placeholder = 'Search street, place or zip code'
        }") %>%
  addLegend(opacity = 0.6,
            values = assaults_district$rate_last12, 
            pal = assaultpal1,
            position = "bottomleft", 
            title = paste(sep="","<popuptitle>Assault Rate<br><popupchatter>Assaults/100K people<br>Citywide: ",prettyNum(round(assaults_city$rate_last12,0), big.mark=",")),
            group = "Rate",
            className = "info legend Rate") %>%
  addLegend(opacity = 0.6,
            values = assaults_district$last12mos, 
            pal = assaultpal2,
            position = "bottomleft", 
            title = paste(sep="","<popuptitle>Assaults<br><popupchatter>Total assaults<br>Citywide: ",prettyNum(round(assaults_city$last12mos,0), big.mark=",")),
            group = "Number",
            className = "info legend Number") %>%
  addLayersControl(
    baseGroups = c("Rate","Number"),
    options = layersControlOptions(collapsed = FALSE),
    position = 'bottomright') %>% hideGroup(c("Number")) %>%
   htmlwidgets::onRender("
      function(el, x) {
         var updateLegend = function () {
            var selectedGroup = document.querySelectorAll('input:checked')[0].nextSibling.innerText.substr(1);

            document.querySelectorAll('.legend').forEach(a => a.hidden=true);
            document.querySelectorAll('.legend').forEach(l => {
               if (l.classList.contains(selectedGroup)) l.hidden=false;
            });
         };
         updateLegend();
         this.on('baselayerchange', el => updateLegend());
      }"
   )
raleigh_assault_map
```
